comment: Dr. Asmar is the best professor I have ever had. His lectures and recitations are simply phenomenal, and he is very good at teaching the material. Physics 2 can be challenging, but Dr. Asmar is accessible and wants to help his students succeed. This class is very rewarding if you put in the effort. Take this professor at all costs.

Although his class is difficult, Dr. Asmar is the best professor! He's very funny and easy to build a relationship with (I still go see him). His office hours are very helpful for tests. He takes attendance sporadically, and it counts as a quiz grade. Physics 2 is hard in itself, but Dr. Asmar will get you through it if you put in the work.

Dr. Asmar wants his students to be successful. To do so, he expects you to attend every lecture, complete the homework, attend recitations, and utilize office hours. A handful of us became regulars in the physics student lounge. Dr. Asmar was always willing to walk us through any problem, often encouraging us to solve them step by step. Great guy!

Go to office hours!!! That is the only way to do well on the exams, he covers essential test questions in his office. There is also a lot of extra credit for the first 4 exams, but for the final you are on your own. Go to recitations and to every class. He is a great and funny professor and WILL DEFINITELY help you if he sees you put in effort!

Whatever you do, go to his office hours. The average on the first exam and final were both in the 30s, and he doesn't curve. He gives almost 80 points of extra credit to students throughout the semester, but doesn't let it apply to the final exam. He works through crucial problems at his office hours, and it's the best way to be prepared for exams.

Dr. Asmar is a supremely talented physicist and an amazing person. I heard positive things about his course prior to taking this class and he did not disappoint. His E&M lectures are so interesting, with a bit of humor. A true master at inspiring his students to become better problem solvers. If you want to learn from the best, take this professor.

Brilliant man, passionate lecturer, challenging class. He has very high expectations but brings out the best in you. I studied for about 40 hours per test (there's 3). He certainly knows his field and has great connections within it. If all my professors were like Asmar, I'd be an Einstein by now, but bald from all the stress.

Availability window is quite large, as long as he is in his office despite what the syllabus states.
He is also willing to explain topics thoroughly. He will notify what questions will be important on he tests. Despite this, the test questions are on the harder side. I still failed the tests despite knowing what was important.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Asmar is an amazing professor for Physics 2; however, you will have to put in some work yourself. He is very clear on what he expects of you and is very accessible outside of class. Furthermore, his recitations are excellent if you are completely lost in class.

Dr. Asmar made the course fun despite it being very challenging. He is very accessible outside class and he will tell students what to look for for an exam. To succeed on this course you must study and understand the material.
Fantastic course, difficult, but you learn a lot if you put in the work.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Relaxed, very laid back professor and often cracks little jokes in class/recitation. Super passionate about physics. 4 exams however if you pay attention in lectures/recitations/homeworks you can do well. He sets you up in a position to succeed while also making sure that you learn physics. Phys2212 is hard, but 100% would recommend/take again.

Dr. Asmar is hands-down the best professor I've ever had. He is brilliant, passionate, hilarious, and genuinely pleasant to be around. The class is very difficult, but he offsets that by dropping the lowest exam, lets you replace another with a project, and counts homework as 20% of your final grade. 

TL;DR: Dr. Asmar is the perfect professor.

DON'T DO IT, TAKE SOMEONE ELSE. He is an awful professor. The exams only have 4 questions which are extremely hard and the fourth one is a kinda challenge forget to get a 100. I have friends taking the same with another professor and things are going great for them. Just avoid taking his class if you do not want to ruin your GPA with a B or less.

Took him for PHYS2212L (physics lab) and he was a great professor. He grades your physics manual based on your calculations (even if your numbers are wrong but as long as the work is correct). Even if you get a high percentage error or made a mistake, you will still make a good grade. I wouldn't have wanted to take anyone else.
Tough class with difficult tests and homework but if you attend all classes and recitations you will know what you are doing and will be successful.
Amazing professor! Really wants to help students succeed and is super passionate about what he does! 12/10 would take again!
